result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Hazardous Substance with the Intent to Abuse Hazardous Substance

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Defendant Cameron P. Polifka in court.  Attorney John Frank Kerscher appeared by video for Cameron P. Polifka.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF786.

2:22 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cameron P. Polifka in court.  Attorney John Kerscher appearing with the defendant.  Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.  There has been no inducement.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed.  
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  09-30-22
Scheduling conference is set for 10-19-22 at 9:00 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 07-29-22.
Order to report to Two Rivers Police Department for photo and prints
$250.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping and 2 cts. abuse hazardous substance.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
